title: NASA Invites Media to Cover Artemis Mission from Johnson Space Center
summary: Media accreditation is open to attend Artemis II mission activities at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Johnson is where flight controllers in mission control will manage the test flight after liftoff of the first crewed Moon mission under the agency’s Artemis campaign. Targeted to launch no earlier Friday, Feb. 6, the Artemis II mission […]

title: 2026 Civil Space Shortfall Ranking
summary: NASA has identified a list of 32 technology shortfalls and invites you to give input on your critical technology needs using this feedback mechanism. Whether you’re part of the space technology community or an interested member of the public, your input is invaluable. By registering and providing your feedback, you could help inform of national space technology priorities. […]

title: NASA Welcomes Portugal as 60th Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: Portugal is the latest nation to sign the Artemis Accords alongside 59 other countries in a commitment to advancing principles for the responsible exploration of the Moon, Mars, and beyond with NASA. “Portugal joins a cadre of nations building the framework for safe, transparent, and prosperous activity in space,” said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman in […]

title: NASA Stennis Engineer Proud to Serve During NASA’s Return to the Moon
summary: Richard Wear calls it an honor to be working at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, during a historic time as NASA prepares to send astronauts around the Moon for the first time in more than 50 years on the Artemis II mission. “I have not stopped learning in the 15 years […]

title: White Dwarf Star (Artist’s Concept)
summary: A smaller white dwarf star (left) pulls material from a larger star into a swirling accretion disk in this artist’s concept released Nov. 19, 2025, to illustrate the first use of NASA’s IXPE (Imaging X-ray Polarization Explorer) to study a white dwarf star. IXPE spent nearly one week focused on EX Hydrae, a white dwarf […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 29 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 6-97 mission is the fifth Falcon 9 rocket launch of 2026, a rate of roughly one flight every 2.5 days. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 3:00:40 p.m. EST (2000:40 UTC).

title: Últimos preparativos para la primera misión tripulada a la Luna con la campaña Artemis de la NASA
summary: Read this article in English here. title: India’s PSLV suffers second consecutive launch failure, 16 satellites lost
summary: The anomaly Monday morning local time came less than a year after a previous issue that caused the failure of the PSLV-C61 mission.

title: NRO taps Capitol Hill staffer Bill Adkins as principal deputy director
summary:
Former House Defense Appropriations aide takes on day-to-day leadership role at U.S. spy satellite agency
